q: When was the Interim Government formed in India?
desc: The Interim Government was formed on 2nd September 1946 as per the Cabinet Mission's proposals.

q: Who headed the Interim Government formed in 1946?
desc: Jawaharlal Nehru was the head of the Interim Government formed in 1946.

q: Which political party initially refused to join the Interim Government?
desc: The Muslim League initially refused to join the Interim Government.

q: On which date did Prime Minister Attlee announce the British withdrawal from India?
desc: Prime Minister Attlee announced on 20th February 1947 that the British would withdraw by 30th June 1948.

q: When did the Constituent Assembly first meet?
desc: The Constituent Assembly first met on 9th December 1946.

q: Who was elected President of the Constituent Assembly?
desc: Dr. Rajendra Prasad was elected as the President of the Constituent Assembly.

q: When was the Direct Action Resolution passed by the Muslim League?
desc: The Muslim League passed the Direct Action Resolution on 16th August 1946.

q: What was the reason behind Jinnah’s withdrawal from the Cabinet Mission Plan?
pool: Success of Congress in Constituent Assembly voting
answer: Success of Congress in Constituent Assembly voting
desc: Jinnah withdrew his acceptance to the Cabinet Mission Plan due to the Congress’s success in the Constituent Assembly elections.

q: What major outcome followed the Direct Action Resolution?
desc: The Direct Action Resolution led to widespread communal riots.

q: When did Jinnah celebrate Pakistan Day?
desc: Jinnah celebrated Pakistan Day on 27th March 1947.

q: Which plan is also known as the 3rd June Plan?
desc: The Mountbatten Plan, also called the 3rd June Plan, outlined the partition of India.

q: Who formulated the 3rd June Plan?
desc: Lord Mountbatten formulated the plan for partition known as the 3rd June Plan.

q: Which two provinces were to be partitioned as per Mountbatten Plan?
desc: The Mountbatten Plan proposed partitioning Bengal and Punjab.

q: Who was to head the Boundary Commission during partition?
desc: The Boundary Commission was headed by Radcliffe.

q: Which act was implemented on 15th August, 1947?
desc: The Indian Independence Act came into effect on 15th August 1947.

q: What did the Indian Independence Act abolish?
desc: The Indian Independence Act abolished the sovereignty of the British Parliament over India.

q: Which two dominions were created by the Indian Independence Act?
desc: India and Pakistan were created as two separate dominions by the Indian Independence Act.

q: Who was the first Home Minister of Independent India?
desc: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel served as the first Home Minister of Independent India.

q: By when did Sardar Patel integrate all princely states?
desc: By 15th August 1947, Sardar Patel had integrated all princely states.

q: Which princely states acceded later to the Indian Federation?
desc: Kashmir, Hyderabad, Junagarh, along with Goa and Pondicherry, joined India later.

q: Which European power retained control over Goa until later?
desc: Goa was under Portuguese control until it was later integrated into India.

q: Who controlled Pondicherry before it joined India?
desc: Pondicherry was under French control before it joined the Indian Federation.

q: Which regions comprised Pakistan after partition?
pool: Sind, NWFP, British Baluchistan, West Punjab, East Bengal
answer: Sind, NWFP, British Baluchistan, West Punjab, East Bengal
desc: These regions formed Pakistan as per the Indian Independence Act.

q: Which district in Assam had a referendum for joining Pakistan?
desc: Sylhet district in Assam had a referendum as per the Mountbatten Plan.

q: Referendum was held in which province besides Sylhet?
desc: Referendum was held in NWFP to decide if it would join India or Pakistan.

q: Which state had a delayed accession due to Pakistani invasion?
desc: Kashmir acceded to India after a Pakistani tribal invasion in October 1947.

q: The Cabinet Mission Plan aimed to form which of the following?
desc: Cabinet Mission Plan proposed the formation of a Constituent Assembly.

q: Which organization condemned both the British and the Congress in 1946?
desc: Muslim League condemned both in its Direct Action Resolution.

q: Which state was under Portuguese rule till 1961?
desc: Goa remained under Portuguese control until it was annexed in 1961.

q: Which year saw both the Interim Government and Direct Action Resolution?
desc: Both events occurred in 1946 — Interim Government formation and Direct Action.
